description: [African Union] Adopted by the Peace and Security Council (PSC) of the African Union (AU) at its 1315th meeting (Emergency Session) held on 28 November 2025 on the emergency situation in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.
title: Africa: Communiqué of the African Union Peace and Security Council on the Emergency Situation in Guinea-Bissau

description: [African Union] Giving the key note address at the opening of the session of the 12th High-Level Seminar on Peace &amp; Security in Africa (#Oran Process), in Algiers, #Algeria. the AU Commission Chairperson, H.E. Mahmoud Ali Youssouf commended Algeria for its leadership in African diplomacy &amp; its principled role on the UN Security Council. He paid tribute to outgoing members of the UNSC, Sierra Leone &amp; Algeria, &amp; welcomed the DRC &amp; Liberia as they join at a pivotal moment for Africa's multilateral
title: Africa: AUC Chairperson Commended Algeria for Its Leadership in African Diplomacy &amp; Its Principled Role On the UN Security Council

description: [African Union] The Chairperson of the African Union Commission, H.E. Mahmoud Ali Youssouf, extends his congratulations to the Government and people of the Central African Republic on the occasion of their Independence Day.
title: Africa: The Chairperson of the African Union Commission Message On the Occasion of the Independence Day of the Central African Republic

description: [Agenzia Fides] Bangui -- "This is an unprecedented historical event: it is about rebuilding our country and putting it on the path of social development and economic growth," the bishops of the Central African Republic stated in their message entitled "For Zion's sake I will not be silent, for Jerusalem's sake I will not be quiet, Until her vindication shines forth like the dawn and her victory like a burning torch (Isaiah 62:1)" regarding the general elections on December 28.
title: Central Africa: Africa/Central Africa - Bishops On the Upcoming Elections - 'A Historic Event That Must Not Be Wasted'

description: [allAfrica] They came, and they saw, and they 'conquered.' The message was loud and clear: ignore Tobacco Harm Reduction (THR) science, and millions of smokers will face preventable premature death.
title: Africa: Reflections on Good COP 2.0 - A Human Story

description: [RFI] As World AIDS Day is marked around the globe, rapid scientific progress is being overshadowed by funding shortfalls and weakened health systems that are putting the global fight against HIV at risk.
title: Africa: World Aids Day Highlights Major Innovations Amid Decline in Global Funding

description: [ISS] Sound relations with foreign nationals living in South Africa will help police gather intelligence, solve cases and prevent violence.
title: Africa: Trust Between Police and Foreign Nationals Can Improve Safety for All

description: [Vanguard] South Africa, Eswatini and Zambia were to begin on Monday administering a groundbreaking new HIV-prevention injection in the drug's first public rollouts in Africa, which has the world's highest HIV burden.
title: Africa: Worlds Aids Day - HIV Prevention Vaccine to Begin in Africa

description: [IPS] Bratislava -- "It's like adding fuel to an already burning fire," says Aditia Taslim.
title: Africa: Vulnerable Populations Will Suffer With UNAIDS Early Closure

description: [Africa Check] No, the US isn't shutting its borders entirely, as TikTok videos claim
title: Africa: No, the Us Isn't Shutting Its Borders Entirely, As Tiktok Videos Claim

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- A new study conducted across three African countries has found that an injectable HIV treatment--Cabotegravir/Rilpivirine (CAB LA + RPV LA), administered every two months--is safe, well tolerated, and preferred by most patients.
title: Africa: New Injectable HIV Treatment Shows Promise in Africa, Study Finds

description: [New Times] As ComzAfrica celebrates its 15th anniversary, the home-grown technology company reflects on a decade and a half of shaping digital financial services across the continent.
title: Africa: Comzafrica Marks 15 Years of Shaping Africa's Digital Financial Landscape

description: [New Times] Nyamagabe District and the current investor in the Gitare Mill wheat processing factory are in talks with a potential new investor who may acquire or buy shares in the business to help secure financing needed to resume operations, The New Times has learnt.
title: Africa: OCP Africa in Talks to Revive Nyamagabe's Stalled Wheat Factory

description: [Health-e] "It was a nice and hot day, there was this breeze. But for me, it was a cold front. That's how bad it was. And already I was now experiencing AIDS symptoms," Nombuyiselo Mapongwana (58) recalls from the living room of her Soweto home.
title: Africa: HIV in South Africa - Lessons From the Past, Challenges for the Future

description: [IPS] United Nations -- Although Africa holds more than 30 per cent of the world's critical green minerals--including cobalt, lithium, manganese, and rare earth elements vital for building batteries, wind turbines and solar panels-- this has not translated into prosperity for the continent.
title: Africa: Africa's Critical Minerals Poised to Power Global Green Energy Transition

description: [WHO] On World AIDS Day, the World Health Organization (WHO) calls on governments and partners to rapidly expand access to new WHO-approved tools including lenacapavir (LEN) to drive down infections and counter disruption to essential health services caused by cuts to foreign aid.
title: Africa: New Prevention Tools and Investment in Services Essential in the Fight Against Aids

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- As the world commemorates World AIDS Day today, UNAIDS is sounding the alarm over a historic setback in the global HIV response, urging nations to make radical shifts in HIV programming and financing or risk losing decades of progress.
title: Africa: UNAIDS Warns of Historic Setback in Global HIV Response On World Aids Day 2025

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - December 1, 2025

description: [Premium Times] The organisation said the continent must urgently protect hard-won gains against HIV amid a rapidly changing global funding landscape that threatens to slow progress.
title: Africa: WHO Warns of Shrinking HIV Funding, Urges African Govts to Boost Investment

description: [RFI] Plagued by child labour and other harmful industrial practices, countries in Africa have a duty to regulate business and hold companies to account for violating children's rights, experts told a conference in Lesotho this week.
title: Africa: Call to Put Child Welfare At the Heart of Business Regulation in Africa

description: [E.G. Pediatric Aids Foundation] Reabetsoe waves and laughs as his mother, Motšelisi Tsubane, 23, leans in, singing his name and dangling a homemade ball. Reabetsoe is a healthy 4-month-old, learning how to focus his eyes and move his arms and legs. He has transformed this family.
title: Africa: Young Mothers Rewrite the Story of Lesotho

description: [ANGOP] Luanda -- High-ranking African individuals recognized on Saturday, in Maseru, Lesotho, the leadership of the Angolan President João Lourenço in mediating conflicts, strengthening human rights and protecting children in crisis contexts.
title: Africa: AU Recognizes Angolan President Leadership in Defending Children's Rights

description: [New Times] Rwanda is positioning itself as a leading FinTech hub in Africa through its FinTech Strategy 2024-2029, which envisions Rwanda as the Africa's FinTech center of gravity. This ambition prompts scepticism: can a small market challenge established giants like Nigeria, Kenya, South Africa, and Egypt? These Big Four have traditionally dominated the FinTech sector through sheer market size and funding, attracting 80% of Africa's FinTech investment in 2024 alone.
title: Africa: Is Rwanda Ready to Become Africa's Fintech Center of Gravity?

description: [WHO] WHO, in partnership with 42 African Member States, has launched a landmark initiative to embed accountability for Preventing and Responding to Sexual Exploitation, Abuse and Harassment (PRSEAH) in joint health operations. The African Strategic Conference on Prevention and Response to Sexual Misconduct in Joint WHO-Member State Operations, held from 17-20 November in Pretoria, is shaping a global model for safeguarding reforms.
title: Africa: WHO and African Health Ministries Set Global Benchmark for Preventing Sexual Exploitation in Joint Health Operations

description: [Afreximbank] Tokyo, Japan, 28 November, 2025: -- African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) has successfully closed its second Samurai bond transaction, securing a total of JPY 81.8 billion (approx. USD 527 million) through Regular and Retail Samurai Bonds offerings.
title: Africa: Afreximbank Successfully Closed Its Second Samurai Bond Transactions, Raising Jpy 81.8 Billion (Approx. USD 527 Million)

description: [Dabanga] Online hate speech is accelerating conflicts across Africa faster than journalists and communities can respond, experts warned at 'Voices in the Shadows Tackling Online Hate Speech in Conflict Affected Communities'. The forum, held on November 10th, was hosted by Digihub Africa and partners including Radio Dabanga, as part of their "Hold Before You Send It" campaign. The initiative seeks to raise awareness of online threats, strengthen digital literacy, and encourage teenagers and young people in conflict
title: Africa: 'Voices in the Shadows' - Online Hate Fuels Violence Across Africa, Youth in Sudan At Risk

description: [UN News] Measles deaths have dropped by 88 per cent since 2000 - yet an estimated 95,000 people, mostly children, still died from the virus last year, the UN World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Friday.
title: Africa: Global Measles Cases Surge As 30 Million Children Miss Vaccines, UN Health Agency Warns

description: [African Arguments] On the fifth floor of one of Nairobi's gleaming innovation hubs, the hum of ambition is palpable. Logos of USAID, DfID, the Mastercard Foundation, and other donors line the walls. Young entrepreneurs in crisp shirts and designer sneakers pitch fintech solutions, climate-tech platforms, and e-commerce applications to panels streaming in from London, New York, and Silicon Valley. Cameras flash, mentors nod, and social media posts announce another "African success story." Visibility, funding, mentorship -
title: Africa: The Aid Economy's Entrepreneurship Mirage

description: [The Conversation Africa] In sub-Saharan Africa, pastoral livestock farming - where cattle, goats and sheep roam freely across grasslands, grazing at will - has been the main form of livestock production. It has been a source of livelihoods for centuries, if not millennia.
title: Africa: Factory Farming in Africa - Development Banks See It As a Good Idea, but It's Bad for the Climate
